metadata.description: Task execution order for AI agents and developers. Tasks are organized into phases. Within each phase, tasks can often be done in parallel unless dependencies are specified.
metadata.usage: Use this file to determine the next task to work on. Start with Phase 1, and work through phases sequentially. Within a phase, tasks can be parallelized if they have no dependencies on each other.

phases.name: Foundation & Architecture
phases.description: Establish system architecture and design foundation. These tasks must be completed before any implementation begins.

tasks.title: Backend Architecture Design and Documentation
tasks.notes: Foundation task - must be completed first. All other backend tasks depend on this.

tasks.title: Customer Management and Automated Promotions Requirements Analysis
tasks.notes: Requirements analysis for customer data management and promotion automation system. Can be done in parallel with TASK-DOC-007.

tasks.title: Dashboard Requirements Analysis and Documentation
tasks.notes: Requirements analysis for dashboard management system. Can be done in parallel with TASK-DOC-007 and TASK-DOC-004.

tasks.title: Domain-Driven Design (DDD) Architecture Design
tasks.notes: DDD architecture design for the application. Should be completed before dashboard architecture (TASK-FEAT-014) as DDD design informs the overall system architecture. Depends on dashboard requirements (TASK-DOC-002) and backend architecture (TASK-ARCH-001).

tasks.title: Comprehensive Website Requirements Analysis and Documentation
tasks.notes: Comprehensive requirements analysis for entire nail salon website covering frontend, backend, performance, security, and non-functional requirements. Foundational documentation task that can be done in parallel with other foundation tasks (TASK-DOC-007, TASK-DOC-004, TASK-DOC-002). Documentation-only task.

tasks.title: Authentication and Authorization Design
tasks.notes: Design authentication and authorization system including user roles, permissions, and security requirements. Required before database schema implementation.

tasks.title: Calendar and Appointment Viewing Requirements Analysis
tasks.notes: Detailed requirements analysis for Calendar and Appointment Viewing functionality. Expands on existing requirements in DASHBOARD_REQUIREMENTS.md. Required before architecture design.

tasks.title: Authorization System Requirements Analysis
tasks.notes: Comprehensive requirements analysis for authorization system including user roles, permissions, access control, security requirements, and integration points with calendar and dashboard modules.

tasks.title: Authorization System Architecture and Design
tasks.notes: Design the architecture for the authorization system following DDD principles. Includes bounded context definition, domain model design, aggregate boundaries, and integration architecture.

phases.name: Database Design
phases.description: Design and document database schema. These tasks establish the data model.

tasks.title: Database Schema Design and Documentation
tasks.notes: Documentation-focused task. Creates ERD diagrams and schema documentation.

tasks.title: Database Schema Design and Entity Models
tasks.notes: Implements TypeORM entities based on schema design from TASK-DB-006.

tasks.title: Database Migrations Setup and Initial Migration
tasks.notes: Creates migration system and initial schema. Database must be ready before API implementation.

tasks.title: Customer Data and Promotion Automation Database Schema
tasks.notes: Database schema for customer management and promotion automation. Depends on requirements analysis.

tasks.title: Dashboard Architecture and Design
tasks.notes: Architecture design for dashboard management system. Required before detailed design. Should follow DDD architecture principles from TASK-ARCH-003.

tasks.title: Dashboard Detailed Design (Class/Component Design)
tasks.notes: Detailed design of classes, components, and modules for dashboard system following DDD principles. Required before database schema implementation and API implementation.

tasks.title: Database Schema for Dashboard System
tasks.notes: Database schema for dashboard management system. Required before API and security implementation.

tasks.title: User Authentication Database Schema
tasks.notes: Database schema for user authentication and authorization. Includes users table extensions, refresh tokens, password history, and login attempt tracking.

tasks.title: Calendar and Appointment Viewing Architecture and Design
tasks.notes: Architecture design for Calendar and Appointment Viewing system. Required before detailed design and database schema implementation.

tasks.title: Calendar and Appointment Viewing Detailed Design
tasks.notes: Detailed design for Calendar and Appointment Viewing including domain layer, application layer, infrastructure layer, and presentation layer. Required before database schema and API implementation.

tasks.title: Calendar and Appointment Viewing Database Schema
tasks.notes: Database schema extensions for Calendar and Appointment Viewing. Extends Appointment entity and creates AppointmentStatusHistory entity. Required before API implementation.

tasks.title: Authorization System Detailed Design
tasks.notes: Create detailed design documentation for the authorization system including class/component design, interface definitions, data flow diagrams, API design, and integration design.

tasks.title: Authorization System Database Schema
tasks.notes: Design and implement the database schema for the authorization system including users, roles, permissions, sessions, and audit logs. Extends existing user authentication schema.

phases.name: API Implementation
phases.description: Implement RESTful API endpoints and business logic.

tasks.title: RESTful API Endpoints Design and Implementation
tasks.notes: Core API implementation. Many tasks depend on this being complete.

tasks.title: Customer Management and Promotion Automation API
tasks.notes: API for customer management and promotion automation. Required before dashboard UI and email/SMS integration.

tasks.title: Dashboard Backend API Implementation
tasks.notes: Backend API for dashboard management system. Uses authentication middleware from TASK-API-005. Required before all dashboard frontend implementations.

tasks.title: Authentication and Authorization API
tasks.notes: Complete authentication and authorization API including login, registration, JWT tokens, password management, and role-based access control. Required before security enhancements.

tasks.title: Calendar and Appointment Viewing Backend API Implementation
tasks.notes: Backend API for Calendar and Appointment Viewing. Includes calendar endpoints, appointment management, availability checking, and export. Required before frontend implementation.

tasks.title: Authorization System Domain Layer Implementation
tasks.notes: Implement the domain layer for the authorization system following DDD principles. Includes value objects, domain entities, domain services, and repository interfaces.

tasks.title: Authorization System Application Layer Implementation
tasks.notes: Implement the application layer for the authorization system including use cases, DTOs, commands, queries, and mappers.

tasks.title: Authorization System Infrastructure Layer Implementation
tasks.notes: Implement the infrastructure layer for the authorization system including repository implementations, database entities, external service integrations, and mappers.

tasks.title: Authorization System Presentation Layer Implementation
tasks.notes: Implement the presentation layer for the authorization system including API controllers, routes, middleware, request/response DTOs, and validation.

phases.name: Infrastructure & Quality
phases.description: Set up infrastructure, testing, and security. These can be done in parallel after API is complete.

tasks.title: Docker Containerization and Orchestration
tasks.notes: Can be done in parallel with TEST-001 and SEC-001. Enhances Docker setup for production.

tasks.title: Backend Testing Infrastructure and Unit Tests
tasks.notes: Can be done in parallel with OPS-004 and SEC-001. Required before migration.

tasks.title: Security Implementation and Best Practices
tasks.notes: Can be done in parallel with OPS-004 and TEST-001. Implements security measures.

tasks.title: Email and SMS Service Integration Setup
tasks.notes: Email and SMS service provider integration for promotion delivery. Can be done in parallel with dashboard UI tasks.

tasks.title: Dashboard Authentication and Authorization
tasks.notes: Dashboard frontend authentication integration. Uses general auth API from TASK-API-005. Implements AuthContext, ProtectedRoute, LoginPage, and role-based UI. Required before all dashboard frontend tasks.

tasks.title: Authentication Security Implementation
tasks.notes: Additional security measures for authentication system including secure token handling, session management, security headers, and security monitoring.

tasks.title: Authorization Integration with Calendar Module
tasks.notes: Integrate the authorization system with the Calendar module to enforce role-based access control for calendar views, appointment management, and data filtering.

tasks.title: Authorization Integration with Dashboard Modules
tasks.notes: Integrate the authorization system with all Dashboard modules (Metrics, Promotions, Content Editor, Gallery, Employee Management) to enforce role-based access control.

phases.name: Client Integration
phases.description: Migrate client to use backend API instead of constants.

tasks.title: Client Migration from Constants to Backend API
tasks.notes: Migrates client from mock data to real API. Requires API and tests to be complete.

tasks.title: Dashboard - Customer Management UI
tasks.notes: Dashboard UI for customer management. Required before promotion automation UI.

tasks.title: Dashboard - Promotion Automation Configuration UI
tasks.notes: Dashboard UI for promotion automation configuration. Depends on customer management UI.

tasks.title: Dashboard Frontend Implementation - Metrics and Analytics
tasks.notes: Dashboard frontend for metrics and analytics. Requires authentication integration. Can be done in parallel with other dashboard frontend tasks (FEAT-016, 017, 018).

tasks.title: Dashboard Frontend Implementation - Promotions Management
tasks.notes: Dashboard frontend for promotions management. Requires authentication integration. Can be done in parallel with FEAT-015, 017, 018.

tasks.title: Dashboard Frontend Implementation - Website Content Editor
tasks.notes: Dashboard frontend for website content editing. Requires authentication integration. Can be done in parallel with FEAT-015, 016, 018.

tasks.title: Dashboard Frontend Implementation - Gallery Image Management
tasks.notes: Dashboard frontend for gallery image management. Requires authentication integration. Can be done in parallel with FEAT-015, 016, 017.

tasks.title: Calendar and Appointment Viewing Frontend Implementation
tasks.notes: Frontend implementation for Calendar and Appointment Viewing. Includes calendar views (day/week/month), appointment management UI, filtering, and export. Requires API and authentication.

tasks.title: Re-style Task Portal Dashboard with Modern Analytics UI
tasks.notes: Re-style the Task Portal dashboard with modern charts and analytics interface. Independent task that can be started anytime. Uses .tasks/resources/dashboard_wireframe.png as design reference.

phases.name: Documentation
phases.description: Final documentation tasks. Should be done after all implementation is complete.

tasks.title: Backend Documentation and API Documentation
tasks.notes: Final documentation task. Should be done after migration is complete.

tasks.title: Customer and Promotion System Testing
tasks.notes: Comprehensive testing for customer and promotion system. Should be done after UI implementation.

tasks.title: Customer and Promotion System Documentation
tasks.notes: Documentation for customer and promotion system. Should be done after testing is complete.

tasks.title: Dashboard Testing Suite
tasks.notes: Comprehensive testing suite for dashboard system. Should be done after all dashboard frontend tasks are complete.

tasks.title: Dashboard Quality Assurance and User Acceptance Testing
tasks.notes: Quality assurance and user acceptance testing for dashboard system. Should be done after testing suite is complete.

tasks.title: Calendar and Appointment Viewing Testing Suite
tasks.notes: Comprehensive testing suite for Calendar and Appointment Viewing including backend unit tests, integration tests, frontend component tests, E2E tests, and performance tests. Required before deployment.

tasks.title: Calendar and Appointment Viewing User Guide
tasks.notes: User-facing documentation for Calendar and Appointment Viewing including user guides, feature tutorials, FAQ, and troubleshooting guide.

tasks.title: Dashboard User Guide and Documentation
tasks.notes: Create comprehensive user-facing documentation for dashboard system including role-specific guides, feature tutorials, FAQ, and troubleshooting. Should be done after all frontend implementation tasks are complete.

tasks.title: Authorization System Testing Suite
tasks.notes: Create comprehensive testing suite for the authorization system including unit tests, integration tests, E2E tests, security tests, and performance tests.

tasks.title: Authorization System Documentation
tasks.notes: Create comprehensive documentation for the authorization system including API documentation, developer guides, user guides, security documentation, and integration guides.

phases.name: Deployment
phases.description: Deploy dashboard system to production. Should be done after all testing is complete.

tasks.title: Dashboard Deployment
tasks.notes: Deploy dashboard system to production environment. Includes staging deployment, production deployment, smoke tests, and monitoring setup. Should be done after all testing is complete.

tasks.title: Calendar and Appointment Viewing Deployment
tasks.notes: Deploy Calendar and Appointment Viewing functionality to production. Includes staging deployment, production deployment, smoke tests, and integration verification. Should be done after testing is complete.

phases.name: AI Task Execution Enhancement
phases.description: Add AI-powered autonomous task execution capability to Task Portal. This feature allows users to trigger AI agents to automatically complete tasks.

tasks.title: Design AI Task Execution Architecture
tasks.notes: Design architecture for AI-powered task execution. Evaluate implementation approaches (client-side vs backend service vs VS Code extension), select AI provider (Anthropic Claude 3.5 Sonnet recommended), design context gathering system, and plan execution environment with safety mechanisms.

tasks.title: Build Backend Service for AI Task Execution
tasks.notes: Build Node.js/Express backend service handling AI task execution requests. Implement REST API, WebSocket server, task queue (Bull + Redis), AI service integration (Anthropic SDK), file system operations, git operations, and authentication.

tasks.title: Implement AI Agent Task Execution Logic
tasks.notes: Implement core AI agent logic: context gathering (task + project + dependencies), execution planning, action execution (code/docs/commands using tools: read_file, write_file, run_command, list_directory, search_files), Definition of Done validation, error recovery with self-healing, and git commit workflow with feature branches.

tasks.title: Add AI Execution Button to Task Portal UI
tasks.notes: Enhance Task Portal static site with 'Execute with AI' button, execution progress modal with real-time log viewer, WebSocket client for live updates (progress/fileChange/command/complete events), configuration panel for API settings, and result viewer. Includes mobile responsive design and browser notifications.

tasks.title: Test AI Task Execution System
tasks.notes: Comprehensively test with simple (>80% success target), medium (>60% success), and complex (>40% success) tasks. Test scenarios include normal execution, missing dependencies, invalid requirements, network interruption, concurrent executions, timeout scenarios, and security attacks. Document success rates, execution times, error scenarios, performance benchmarks, and create improvement backlog.

tasks.title: Document AI Task Execution Feature
tasks.notes: Create comprehensive documentation: user guide (configuration, execution workflow, monitoring, troubleshooting), developer guide (architecture, extending tools, deployment), API reference (REST endpoints, WebSocket events, authentication), troubleshooting guide (common issues, error codes, debugging), and best practices (task structure, cost optimization, security).

nextTaskRecommendation.algorithm: Find the first task in the earliest phase where canStart is true or all dependencies are completed
nextTaskRecommendation.reason: Foundation task with no dependencies. Must be completed before all other backend tasks.

phase1.description: Foundation tasks in Phase 1. TASK-DOC-007, TASK-DOC-004, TASK-DOC-002, and TASK-DOC-008 can be done in parallel. TASK-ARCH-003 depends on TASK-DOC-002 and TASK-ARCH-001.
phase1.note: TASK-DOC-007, TASK-DOC-004, TASK-DOC-002, and TASK-DOC-008 have no dependencies and can be started simultaneously. TASK-ARCH-003 (DDD architecture) should be completed before TASK-FEAT-014 (Dashboard Architecture) as it informs the overall system design.

phase2.description: Some database design tasks can be done in parallel after their dependencies
phase2.note: TASK-DB-001 and TASK-DB-003 can be done in parallel as they depend on different parent tasks (DB-006 vs FEAT-014).

phase3.description: Some API tasks can be done in parallel, but TASK-API-005 (auth) should be completed before TASK-API-002 (dashboard API). Authorization system tasks (API-007, API-008, API-009, SEC-004) form a sequential chain.
phase3.note: TASK-API-001, API-004, and API-005 depend on different database schemas and can be worked on independently. TASK-API-002 depends on API-005 for authentication middleware, so complete API-005 first. Authorization system tasks (API-007 → API-008 → API-009 → SEC-004) must be done sequentially following DDD layer order.

phase4.description: Infrastructure and quality tasks in Phase 4 can be done in parallel. Authorization integration tasks (SEC-005, SEC-006) depend on SEC-004.
phase4.note: TASK-OPS-004, TEST-001, and SEC-001 all depend on their respective API tasks but not on each other, so they can be worked on simultaneously. TASK-SEC-002 depends on TASK-API-005 and blocks dashboard frontend tasks. TASK-SEC-005 and SEC-006 can be done in parallel after SEC-004 is complete.

phase5.description: Dashboard frontend tasks can be done in parallel
phase5.note: All dashboard frontend tasks depend on TASK-API-002 but not on each other, so they can be worked on simultaneously.

phase8.description: AI Task Execution enhancement can be developed independently of other features
phase8.note: TASK-FEAT-028 (architecture) has no dependencies and can start anytime. TASK-FEAT-027 (AI agent logic) and TASK-FEAT-029 (UI button) both depend on TASK-API-010 (backend service), so they can be developed in parallel after the backend is ready.

notes.executionStrategy: Work through phases sequentially. Within each phase, check dependencies. If all dependencies are met, the task can start.
notes.parallelWork: Multiple task groups can be worked on in parallel. See 'parallelization' section for details. Dashboard, customer-promotions, and AI task execution features can be developed in parallel after foundation tasks.
notes.blockingTasks: Pay attention to 'blocking' field - these tasks cannot start until the current task is complete.
notes.priority: HIGH priority tasks should be completed before MEDIUM priority tasks in the same phase when possible.
notes.featureParallelism: Dashboard system (TASK-DOC-002 → FEAT-014 → DB-003 → API-002), Customer Promotions (TASK-DOC-004 → DB-004 → API-004), and AI Task Execution (TASK-FEAT-028 → API-010 → FEAT-027) can be developed in parallel as they are independent feature sets.
notes.criticalPaths: There are six main critical paths: (1) Core backend infrastructure, (2) Dashboard system, (3) Customer Promotions system, (4) Authentication system, (5) Authorization system, and (6) AI Task Execution. These can progress independently after Phase 1, though dashboard requires authentication before frontend implementation.
notes.authenticationNote: Authentication system (DOC-006 → DB-005 → API-005 → SEC-003) provides system-wide auth that dashboard (SEC-002) and other features use. Dashboard frontend tasks require both API-002 and SEC-002 (which depends on API-005).
notes.authorizationNote: Authorization system (DOC-014 → ARCH-004 → DOC-015 → DB-008 → API-007 → API-008 → API-009 → SEC-004 → SEC-005 → SEC-006 → TEST-008 → DOC-016) provides comprehensive role-based access control. It integrates with calendar (SEC-005) and dashboard modules (SEC-006). The system follows DDD principles with sequential layer implementation (Domain → Application → Infrastructure → Presentation).
notes.aiTaskExecutionNote: AI Task Execution feature (FEAT-028 → API-010 → FEAT-027 → TEST-009 → DOC-017) adds autonomous task execution to Task Portal. It's a standalone feature that can be developed independently. Uses GitHub Copilot (already paid, $0 additional cost) with optional Google Gemini free tier fallback. Implemented as VS Code extension enhancement with user approval workflow and git-based safety mechanisms. Estimated cost: $0/month (GitHub Copilot) or $0-20/month (Gemini if used).
